replies.bodyText:
Since we have a release, I am also in favor of using 0.3.0.
When we will introduce/change SDK APIs, we should change this to 0.4.0-SNAPSHOT
replies.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: I think we never want to push this to maven. Having this without snapshot may cause mistakes and push them to maven central
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: I was thinking to have this as 0.4.0-Snapshot same as API/sdk
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText:
I did mostly to keep the invariant of other examples. I'm fine using SNAPSHOT for now.
I think it's a minor thing, so lets go with 0.4.0-SNAPSHOT for now - if we face any problem, we will realize it soon and will fix that by then ;)
replies.author: carlosalberto

replies.bodyText:
Oh, actually just realized examples depend on published artifacts (see log below). So we can have 0.4.0-SNAPSHOT as version but consume whatever published artifacts we have (0.3.0). Sounds good enough for you @bogdandrutu ?
* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':compileJava'.
> Could not resolve all files for configuration ':compileClasspath'.
   > Could not find io.opentelemetry:opentelemetry-api:0.3.0-SNAPSHOT.
     Searched in the following locations:
       - https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/io/opentelemetry/opentelemetry-api/0.3.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml
       - https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/io/opentelemetry/opentelemetry-api/0.3.0-SNAPSHOT/opentelemetry-api-0.3.0-SNAPSHOT.pom
       - https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/io/opentelemetry/opentelemetry-api/0.3.0-SNAPSHOT/opentelemetry-api-0.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
replies.author: carlosalberto

replies.bodyText:
Ok, so let's clarify:

version '0.3.0' causes the generated Jar to have the version 0.3.0 which is something that I try to avoid because in case of a mistake and these get pushed to maven will not end up in the maven central repo.
You are using version for the opentelemetry dependencies, which is not correct because version is a special keyword and represents the version of this target. So you need to define a new variable opencensusVersion = '0.3.0', and there we use the released  '0.3.0' version.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: Also the version for the example jar can stay at 0.1.0-SNAPSHOT always and don't have to change that because we don't intend to ever release them to maven or do a release at all.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText:
and 2) correct.

So lets keep them separated and lets keep the versions are as 0.1.1-SNAPSHOT to signal they remain independent (and non published).
replies.author: carlosalberto
